Recap: At the boarding school, Matthew is ready to escape to Tahiti with Dani after she's informed him that her mother is going to take her away. But he is kind of torn between her and Destiny and admits how much Destiny means to him and how much he will misses her. Meanwhile, Tea, Elijah and the head mistress all try and fail to find Dani. Bo and Nora admit that they have always loved each other. And she concludes that she is going to break up with Clint. And they decide to go back to Llanview together. Stacy gloats when she notices that Gigi is not able to get a hold of Rex when he is in Michigan. Rex's aunt Corrine and Brody's sister have Rex and Brody drugged and tied up. John comes by. Brody breaks free. Jessica gets ready to leave and go back to her daughter. But when she's outside in the dark, it appears that she runs into somebody. It might be Jared. IT might be Nash.
Transcript: Nora: I really have to go back to Llanview.
Bo: Did you hear what I just said?
Nora: Yes. You love me.
Bo: Yeah, and you love me.
Nora: Yes.
Bo: Yeah, so that's out there now. That -- that doesn't go away.
Nora: I know.
Bo: But you're going home to Clint. Are you running away from us?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Eli: You know I'm right, Téa. Sooner or later, you're going to have to tell Danielle who her real father is.
Téa: All I know is, right now, I have to get her out of here. How long does it take to pack?
Eli: She's a teenage girl. And she's furious at you. I'm sure she's in no hurry.
Téa: All I've been hearing about for months is how much she hates it here.
Eli: Yeah. It doesn't mean she wants to leave with you. Especially since she found out my brother was here looking for her yesterday.
Téa: That's why I have to get her out of here. If he gets his hands on her, I'll never see my little girl again.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Matthew: Destiny, what -- what are you doing here?
Destiny: I figured out where you were from your phone message. Your brother David and I hopped on a plane.
Matthew: You and David? Get out of here.
Destiny: I was so worried. Your parents finally told me where they stashed you. What's with the luggage? Are you going somewhere?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: Jeff, hi.
Jeff: You're off tonight.
Gigi: Yes. I just need my paycheck, fast.
Jeff: I'm not sure if they're here yet.
Gigi: Oh, could you look?
Jeff: What's your hurry?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nadine: He's out?
Corrine: Well, it looks like. Rex? Rex? You must have used enough to drug a moose.
Nadine: Well, the last thing we need is him waking up.
Corrine: Well, I don't need him dead, either.
[Nadine sighs]
Nadine: He's fine. The hard part's over.
Corrine: Oh, what? You mean lying to my only nephew who never did me wrong in his whole life?
Nadine: Yeah, that part.
Corrine: Why?
Nadine: Just don't ask. We have our instructions. That's all we can think about right now.
Corrine: Right. Keeping Rex away from Natalie.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Natalie: Now I wish Rex was here. I mean, I understand about his Aunt Corrine, but still --
Jessica: Maybe he emailed.
Natalie: Rex?

Natalie: Well, maybe that's why Jared hasn't called.
Jessica: If he's here, Natalie.
Natalie: It has to be him. I mean, why else would he have mapped out the route to -- to Napa on that motel computer? Plus, that coffee pot was still warm. Someone's here.
Jessica: Or it's the guy pretending to be Nash.
Natalie: It's sick, I know. I'm really sorry.
Jessica: I just don't understand why I can't get ahold of him.
Natalie: You know what? I'm sure that he handled his sister's problems. He's now probably back in Llanview --
Jessica: He would have called me, Natalie -- if he could.
Natalie: Are you afraid that something's happened to Brody?
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Brody groans]
Nadine: Okay, come on. Yes, he's your darling nephew. I just did the same thing to my only brother. You know a way out of it?
Corrine: I'll take his feet.
Nadine: Okay.
[Doorbell rings]
[Doorbell continues ringing]
Corrine: Answer it!
Nadine: Are you nuts?
Corrine: No. They're aren't going away. You have to.
Nadine: Ugh -- okay. Can you take him from here?
Corrine: Yeah.
Nadine: All right. I'll get rid of whoever that is. Go, go!
[Doorbell continues ringing]
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nora: Oh. You should have heard Clint on the phone just now.
Bo: What did he say?
Nora: Everything right.
Bo: Well, I mean, he can do that sometimes. But that's all it took?
Nora: It was like a big dose of reality that just hit me in the face.
Bo: We're not real?
Nora: No. No, we're not -- not here. Certainly not here. We're in, like, this little cocoon here. Here, Clint and our life in Llanview -- it doesn't even exist, you know?
Bo: Yeah.
Nora: I -- I can't kiss you and tell you that I love you when I'm married to your brother.
Bo: I still can't believe you're married.
Nora: Well, I am.
Bo: It never felt real.
Nora: Oh, I should have stopped the wedding.
Bo: Yeah, I thought you were going to, you know? Five times, but -- hell, I thought I was going to stop it.
Nora: Yeah, I did, too.
Bo: And I should have. But, you know, you married my brother.
Nora: And we both love him.
Bo: So what's going on, red? Is that it?
Nora: What?
Bo: I mean, did we miss, you know? Tough luck? Is it too late for us?

Dani: Matthew, we have to go.

Eli: Of course she would. She thinks he's her father.

Eli: Fine.
Téa: Look, how am I supposed to tell Daniella that Ross is not her father without telling her that Todd is?
Eli: You can't.

Eli: You'll figure something out. Meanwhile, I am going to fly the two of you out of here. Where are you going?
Téa: No, no, no. Uh-uh, uh-uh.
Eli: Why not? Don't you trust me?
Téa: I've made enough decisions for Daniella. I'm not going to make that mistake again. I'll give her a few choices. Where the hell is she?

Gigi: Hey.

Gigi: Good. Great. I'm just here to pick up my check.

Schuyler: Uh-huh. So this is it?
Gigi: What?

Schuyler: Okay, you ever wonder why it's such a struggle if you're sure you don't want me?
Gigi: I'm going out of town. Okay? For a few days. Rex is in Michigan taking care of his sick aunt, and I'm going to go help him.

Nadine: Hello?

Nadine: John, you just missed him.
John: You got to be kidding me.

John: That's funny; he said he'd be here.

Jessica: Maybe Brody called the house.

Natalie: Whoa! Jared didn't kill anyone. He didn't!
Jessica: The last two people he ran scams with are dead! And now he's disappeared.
Natalie: That's because he knows. He knows that John is dying to pin all of this on him.
Jessica: We never should have stayed here alone, Natalie. We should have called the cops like you told Rex that we would. We are sitting ducks here, Natalie!
Natalie: No, we're not!
Jessica: Do you get that? God! Rex never would have left if he hadn't known that you didn't call John.
Natalie: It wouldn't help!
Jessica: I shouldn't have let that happen.
Natalie: What are you doing?
Jessica: I'm calling John. I don't care what you say.
Jessica: Natalie, I'm calling John. Enough's enough.
Natalie: Okay, please -- please don't. Jared didn't kill anyone.
Jessica: Well, then John will give him a fair shot.
Natalie: Really? Really? You think John's going to give my husband a chance? He's convinced that he's guilty, and how in the world is Jared going to prove he's innocent while he's locked up?
Jessica: Well, he'll have a lawyer, won't he?
Natalie: The case will be closed. There won't be any more questions. Do you want to find out who's pretending to be Nash? Do you want to find out --
Jessica: Yes, of course I do. Of course.
Natalie: Okay. Then give us a chance to find out before John gets involved and shuts us down.
Jessica: Okay.
Natalie: Thank you. Well, what are you -- what are you doing?
Jessica: I am going to call John to see if he's heard from Brody and see if he has any news about Jared. Don't worry. I won't tell him where we are.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Nadine: Hey, you can't just burst in --
John: Relax. It's just this little game we play.

Eli: Hold on.

Headmistress: Miss Delgado, there's no need for --

Headmistress: Now, really --
Téa: No, no, no, you listen to me. You get your security forces -- your famous security forces to go to her room and ask for her back here immediately!

Destiny: Sure.

Destiny: Yeah.

Destiny: That doesn't matter anymore. I'll bet Greg will do your surgery now. You don't have to go to Seattle. You can come back to Llanview with me.

Nora: Do you want an answer to that now?
Bo: Depends.
Nora: On?

Nora: You know, I remember our wedding. Every second of it.

[Bo chuckles]
Nora: I honestly believed that I was going to grow old with you.
Bo: Me, too.

Bo: No, no, but, Nora, that's over.

Nora: Mm-hmm.

Bo: Will you leave Clint and try again with me?

Matthew: I'm going to Tahiti to help Danielle find her dad.
